content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
─────────────────────
### Copper Cable Factory at ~ (2.5, 17.5)
Consists of the following entities:
– New factory burner inserter at (2.5, 16.5)  
– Cable factory input chest at (2.5, 17.5)  
– Dedicated burner inserter (using direction RIGHT) at (3.5, 17.5)

### Belt Depot at (3.5, 15.5)
Consists of the following entities:
– Wooden chest placed as a belt depot at (3.5, 15.5)  
– Transport belt segment adjacent to the chest at (4.5, 15.5)  
– Depot burner inserter (using direction UP) at (3.5, 14.5)

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• Belt Connection Issues  
 – When connecting transport belts, the target entity must be an inserter with input capability rather than a Prototype.SteamEngine. Always verify the target’s type before attempting a connection.

• Entity Placement Issues  
 – Placement out-of-range errors occur when the player is too far from the target position. Ensure you move within the allowed placement range (max distance 10) before placing an entity.  
 – Inventory-related errors (e.g. missing wooden chest) can be avoided by checking the inventory for required items prior to placement.  
 – Undefined variable errors (such as “target_chest” not defined) indicate that all target variables must be correctly assigned and referenced before use.
